segments.text: Hi, Lise. How you doing today?
Yeah, I'm aware you have some symptoms that have been bothering you. Can you tell me about those?

Adhd? Alright, so we'll talk about that. Let me ask you a few quick questions before we get to that. Do you ever feel depressed? No. Anxious? No. Any trouble with drugs or alcohol? Oh, no, nothing like that. Okay. Why do you think you have adhd?
Alright, so trouble establishing attention.
How about difficulty and holding attention, like once you have established it?
Trouble with both of those. And you mentioned the word distracted.
So you find yourself easily distracted? Yes. You do. Okay, how about. Well, give me an idea of the setting. So is this at work or school?
It's everywhere. Time. So do you work? Yes, I do. Yeah. Do you go to school?
How old are you?
24. Alright. And this problem with the attention affects you at work and at school and you said everywhere?
All right, you're 24 now. When did you first notice the attention problems?
You've had it for a long time. Yeah. How about how disturbing is, like how much is it interfering with your functioning?
It's really problematic for you. Okay, so I'm gonna ask you a few other questions here. We talked about the attention. So it's hard for you to give attention and hold attention?
How about listening? Let's go with the school environment for now. Let's talk about school. How about listening in class?
That's not a problem for you?
How about following instructions? No. Tell me about your organizational skills.
You're very organized.
In college. Do you find yourself avoiding activities that require a lot of mental investment, mental energy?
No. No. Do you. Do you move toward those type of activities?
All right. Do you ever find yourself losing things that you need to complete different jobs or tasks?
No. Okay. I'm gonna change gears and ask you some other questions around a different area, okay? Okay. Do you ever find yourself, like, fidgeting, tough to stay still?
No. No. In school again, we'll kind of stick with the school environment. Okay. Do you find it difficult to stay seated?
How do you do when you are engaging in a quiet activity?
You do okay with that? Yeah. You don't find yourself wandering off?
Okay. Do you ever feel like internally there's a motor running and you can't shut it off? No. No. How about being talkative? Do you find yourself talking?
You're very talkative?
Alright. So you feel like you talk a lot and that you interrupt?

In a situation where it would be traditional to, like, wait in line or wait your turn, do you find that's difficult for you? No. No. Do you ever find yourself, like, for example, in class just saying something, like blurting something out without giving it much thought?

No. Okay. All right. I think I have what I need here and I want to get you in to see a counselor. Okay. If that works for you, because you did mention this was affecting your functioning. So I want to make sure you get to see a counselor. It'll just take a couple days to get you in to see something. If that works for you, that's great. Thank you. Yeah. I appreciate you taking this time with me. This information has been helpful.
Thanks, Elise.
